Chef Justin Sutherland’s Pimento Cheese Juicy Lucy with Tillamook Recipe | Bon Appetit




















































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLoginSPONSOREDChef Justin Sutherland’s Pimento Cheese Juicy Lucy with TillamookSponsored by TillamookFacebookPinterestTwitterEmailServes 4Not all pimento cheeses are created equal. Chef Justin Sutherland of Handsome Hog, and other popular restaurants across the Twin Cities, uses Tillamook Sharp Cheddar for maximum flavor in this southern staple made into a midwest mainstay.PrintIngredientsPimento Cheese2 cups (4 ½ oz.)  Tillamook Sharp Cheddar, grated on the large holes of a box grater1 ¼ cups pimentos, drained well and finely diced1 cup (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened1 cup mayonnaise2 ½ tsp.  bourbon smoked paprika (recommended); substitute with traditional smoked paprika if needed2 tsp. hot sauce2 tsp. kosher salt¼ tsp. sugar¼ tsp. white pepper⅛ tsp. cayenne pepperBurgers and assembly2 lbs ground beef8 soft burger bunsToppings of choiceRecipe PreparationMix pimento cheese ingredient together until well blended. Flatten 4 small 2-oz. (2 Tbsp.) disks of pimento cheese (about 2-inches wide) and freeze 20 minutes or longer. Refrigerate remaining pimento cheese.Form 8 burger patties each about 4 ½ -inches in diameter. Place a frozen round of cheese between two burger patties sealing edges very well to contain filling. Season burgers with salt and pepper and sear over moderately high heat in a cast iron skillet, about 6 minutes per side, until burgers are cooked through and cheese is melty.Serve on buns along with any desired toppings.Tillamook is a farmer-owned cooperative based in Oregon that connects farmers and food lovers through better-made dairy products. You can purchase Tillamook at a retailer near you, or find their cheese nationally at Target.
